titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ewald Flügel Collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Miscellaneous items pertaining to Ewald Flügel including a notebook on Beowulf, n.d.; a printed syllabus for his course on the history of early English literature, 1914; two reprints by Flügel: "Prayers for Peace and Dynamite Orders," 1914, and "Henry Bradshaw, Librarian and Scholar," 1904; a document in German, 1896; two letters to Frederick E. Brasch, one from A. W. Pollard re incunabula catalogues, 1913, and one from Sydney S. mourning Flügel's death; a postcard to Mrs. Brasch regarding a reception being held at Flügel's home, 1914; ; and a photocopy of the notice of completion of work on Flugel’s Palo Alto home, 1897.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Ewald Flügel Collection (SCM0191). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Ewald Flügel was Professor of English at Stanford University from 1892 until his death in 1914. He received his Ph.D. from the University of Leipzig in 1886; his specialty was Anglo-Saxan literature and Chaucer.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous items pertaining to Ewald Flügel including a notebook on Beowulf, no date; a printed syllabus for his course on the history of early English literature, 1914; two reprints by Flügel: "Prayers for Peace and Dynamite Orders," 1914, and "Henry Bradshaw, Librarian and Scholar," 1904; a document in German, 1896; two letters to Frederick E. Brasch, one from A. W. Pollard re incunabula catalogues, 1913, and one from Sydney S. mourning Flügel's death; a postcard to Mrs. Brasch regarding a reception being held at Flügel's home, 1914; ; and a photocopy of the notice of completion of work on Flugel’s Palo Alto home, 1897.
